comments:
Build ID: 3.2

Steps To Reproduce:
1.Create a new runtime component

     <runtime-component-type
       id="com.me.someid">
    </runtime-component-type>
   
    <runtime-component-version
       type="com.me.someid"
       version="6.5"/>

    <supported>
      <runtime-component
         id="com.me.someid"
         version="6.5"/>
      <facet
         id="jst.xxx"
         version="3.0"/>
    </supported>


2. Use any of the project wizards that give you the ability to target a server runtime. Clicking new will result in stack overflow, infinite loop if the

    <runtime-component-version
       type="com.me.someid"
       version="6.5"/>

    <supported>
      <runtime-component
         id="com.me.someid"
         version="6.5"/>
      <facet
         id="jst.xxx"
         version="3.0"/>
    </supported>

section is in the plugin.xml but if not, no stack overflow.




More information:
The log will look like this when you hit code trying to create and register the new runtime component type:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 2007-04-11 16:27:42.171
!MESSAGE Unhandled event loop exception
!STACK 0
java.lang.StackOverflowError
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Path.collapseSlashes(Path.java:369)

	at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.internal.Runtime.getLocation(Runtime.java:119)
	at org.eclipse.jst.server.core.internal.RuntimeBridge$Stub.getRuntimeComponents(RuntimeBridge.java:133)
	at org.eclipse.wst.common.project.facet.core.runtime.internal.BridgedRuntime.getRuntimeComponents(BridgedRuntime.java:59)
	at org.eclipse.wst.common.project.facet.core.runtime.internal.AbstractRuntime.equals(AbstractRuntime.java:181)
